modules.description: This module provides operations for constructing and manipulating build rules, dependencies, and installation configurations within a domain-specific language, including actions like file globbing, dependency tracking, and environment manipulation. It works with structured representations of build metadata, internal types such as `[ `Dep ]` and `[ `Action ]`, and symbolic values to express complex logic. Use cases include defining executable targets, managing library dependencies, and specifying file installation paths.

Generates Dune include files using a domain-specific language embedded in OCaml, supporting type-safe construction of executable and library definitions, rule targets, and dependencies. It processes structured data like names, paths, and build rules, enabling parameterization of string values through external JSON configurations. This allows reusable Dune logic for generating multiple similar build configurations without duplication.

manages build rules, dependencies, and installation configurations through a domain-specific language, using types like `[ `Dep ]` and `[ `Action ]` to represent structured build metadata. It supports file globbing, dependency tracking, and environment manipulation, enabling the definition of executable targets and library dependencies. Operations include constructing complex logic with symbolic values and expressing installation paths. Examples include setting up build pipelines, managing transitive dependencies, and automating file installation.
